item.title: Jimmie add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "We shall not cease from exploration And the end of all our exploring Will be to arrive where we started And know the place for the first time." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "April is the cruelest month, breeding lilacs out of the dead land, mixing memory and desire, stirring dull roots with spring rain." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description:
"We are the hollow men We are the stuffed men Leaning together Headpiece filled with straw. Alas! Our dried voices, when We whisper together Are quiet and meaningless As wind in dry grass Or rats' feet over broken glass In our dry cellar Shape without form, shade without colour, Paralysed force, gesture without motion;
- <i>The Hollow Men</i>" -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "I said to my soul, be still and wait without hope, for hope would be hope for the wrong thing; wait without love, for love would be love of the wrong thing; there is yet faith, but the faith and the love are all in the waiting. Wait without thought, for you are not ready for thought: So the darkness shall be the light, and the stillness the dancing." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "I will show you fear in a handful of dust." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description:
"Let us go then, you and I, When the evening is spread out against the sky Like a patient etherised upon a table; Let us go, through certain half-deserted streets, The muttering retreats 5 Of restless nights in one-night cheap hotels And sawdust restaurants with oyster-shells: Streets that follow like a tedious argument Of insidious intent To lead you to an overwhelming question … 10 Oh, do not ask, “What is it?” Let us go and make our visit.
In the room the women come and go Talking of Michelangelo." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Imagine yourself as a living house. God comes in to rebuild that house. At first, perhaps, you can understand what He is doing. He is getting the drains right and stopping the leaks in the roof and so on; you knew that those jobs needed doing and so you are not surprised. But presently He starts knocking the house about in a way that hurts abominably and does not seem to make any sense. What on earth is He up to? The explanation is that He is building quite a different house from the one you thought of - throwing out a new wing here, putting on an extra floor there, running up towers, making courtyards. You thought you were being made into a decent little cottage: but He is building a palace. He intends to come and live in it Himself." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art.... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things which give value to survival." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning..." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The value of myth is that it takes all the things you know and restores to them the rich significance which has been hidden by the veil of familiarity." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Readers are advised to remember the devil is a liar." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Die before you die, there is no chance after." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If you are a Christian you do not have to believe that all the other religions are simply wrong all through. If you are an atheist you do have to believe that the main point in all the religions of the whole world is simply one huge mistake." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "How could an idiotic universe have produced creatures whose mere dreams are so much stronger, better, subtler than itself?" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Surely what a man does when he is taken off his guard is the best evidence for what sort of man he is." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Let's pray that the human race never escapes Earth to spread its iniquity elsewhere." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by Walter C. Kaiser Jr.
item.description: "It was ever and always the plain offer of God to all the peoples of the earth through his elected servants of the promise-plan." -- Walter C. Kaiser Jr.

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "How many legs does a dog have if you call the tail a leg? Four. Calling a tail a leg doesn't make it a leg." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "You cannot lift the wage earner up by pulling the wage payer down." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I have been driven many times upon my knees by the overwhelming conviction that I had no where else to go. My own wisdom and that of all about me seemed insufficient for that day." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Lets have faith that right makes might; and in that faith let us, to the end, dare to do our duty as we understand it." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jimmie add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "If this country is ever demoralized, it will come from trying to live without work." -- Abraham Lincoln
